sentences.en: ‘There’s nothing we can do about it.’ ‘You reckon (= used to express doubt or disagreement ) ?’
sentences.cn: “这件事我们无能为力。”“是吗？”

sentences.en: Did you reckon in the cost of the taxi?
sentences.cn: 你把坐计程车的费用计算在内了 吗 ?

sentences.en: Do you reckon he’ll agree to see us?
sentences.cn: 你认为他会同意见我们吗？

sentences.en: Don't reckon upon the weather being fine for your garden party.
sentences.cn: 不要指望你举行游园会时会是好天气.

sentences.en: Don't reckon upon your relatives to help you out of trouble.
sentences.cn: 不要指望你的亲戚会帮助你摆脱困境.

sentences.en: I reckon I'm due one of my travels.
sentences.cn: 我想我就要开始我的一次旅行了.

sentences.en: I reckon she has good reason to feel smug.
sentences.cn: 我认为她洋洋得意必有其缘故.

sentences.en: I reckon she'll be back by the end of this month.
sentences.cn: 我估摸着她月底就能回来.

sentences.en: I reckon that he is rather too old to marry again.
sentences.cn: 我认为他的年龄太大,不太适于再婚.

sentences.en: I reckon there are at least fifty people in the room.
sentences.cn: 我估计房间里至少有五十个人.

sentences.en: I'll reckon with that boy when he gets home!
sentences.cn: 等那孩子回家后,我要惩罚他!

sentences.en: I'm proud to reckon you among my friends.
sentences.cn: 我自豪地把你看作是我的朋友.

sentences.en: Reckon up all your money and see if you have enough.
sentences.cn: 估算一下你一共有多少钱,看是否已经足够了.

sentences.en: The expression ‘full moon’ means the fourteenth day of the moon reckoned from its first appearance.
sentences.cn: 所谓“满月”是指从新月初现算起的第14天。

sentences.en: The market is reckoned to be worth $1.4 bn in the U.S. alone.
sentences.cn: 这个市场仅在美国的价值估计就有14亿美元。

sentences.en: the trade unions were a political force to be reckoned with.
sentences.cn: 工会是一股不可小视的政治力量。

sentences.en: they hadn't reckoned with a visit from Eunice.
sentences.cn: 他们没有预料到尤妮斯的来访。

sentences.en: Toni reckoned that it must be about three o'clock.
sentences.cn: 托尼想一定是3点钟左右了。

sentences.en: We didn't reckon for the weather turning bad so suddenly.
sentences.cn: 我们没考虑到天气变坏得这么快.

sentences.en: We reckon your pay with our adding machine.
sentences.cn: 我们用加算器来计算你的薪金.

sentences.en: You can always reckon on Jim; he'll never fail you.
sentences.cn: 你总是可以相信吉姆, 他绝不会辜负你.

sentences.en: You can reckon ( up ) to 100 while we hide.
sentences.cn: 我们藏起来时,你从0数到100.

words.tran_cn: 计算手册；计算者；清算人

phrases.phrase: a —to be reckoned with (或 to reckon with)

phrases.tran_cn: 向…结算：与……解决或……结清帐目

trans.tran_en: spoken to think or suppose something
If you reckon that something is true, you think that it is true

trans.tran_cn: 测算，估计，认为，计算，评定，断定
trans.tran_en: spoken to think or suppose something
